intro: Dendrocacalia crepidifolia, commonly known as the mountain spider-orchid, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its unique, spider-like appearance due to its elongated, thread-like flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky outcrops and is adapted to cool, moist environments. Its leaves are basal, lanceolate, and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Dendrocacalia crepidifolia is a rare and specialized species, making it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
